articles.description: A ferry overloaded with people celebrating the Kurdish new year and Mother's Day capsized in the Tigris River near the Iraqi city of Mosul on Thursday, killing nearly 100 people, including families, officials said.

articles.title: Cesar Sayoc pleads guilty to sending pipe bombs to Trump critics
articles.description: The man who sent homemade bombs to Hillary Clinton, Joe Biden and others pleaded guilty to criminal charges on Thursday. Cesar Sayoc now faces life in prison.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Blind man and his dogs make history at the NYC half marathon
articles.description: Thomas Panek became the first blind man -- led by his guide dogs -- to finish the New York City half marathon. CBS News correspondent Don Dahler has their story.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Shelter-in-place order lifted for Texas city near chemical facility fire
articles.description: Authorities on Thursday lifted a shelter-in-place order hours after warning people to stay indoors because high levels of benzene were detected in the air near a scorched petrochemicals storage facility outside of Houston. Officials in Deer Park, Texas, said …

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Europe offers British lawmakers chance to delay Brexit
articles.description: Worn down by three years of indecision in London, European Union leaders on Thursday grudgingly offered the U.K. more time to ease itself out of the EU, delaying by several weeks -- but not eliminating -- the threat of a chaotic British exit.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: James Comey says he "doesn't care" about what's in Mueller's final report, as long as it's transparent
articles.description: Former FBI Director James Comey said Thursday he "doesn't care" what's in the Robert Mueller's final report. Ayesha Rascoe, White House correspondent for NPR, joins "Red & Blue" to discuss what could be coming as the Russia investigation wraps up.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Climate change's role in severe storms and extreme flooding
articles.description: At least 550 people have died as a result of a high intensity cyclone that hit Southern Africa last week. Several parts of the region have been left inudated with flood water. Midwest U.S. is also experiencing record level flooding. CBS News contributing mete…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Boeing issues subpoena as investigators face pressure to provide answers on the Ethiopia crash
articles.description: Boeing was issued a subpoena by the Justice Department's fraud unit and must now retain all documents, reports and data relating to the investigation into its 737 Max planes. Investigators are facing mounting pressure to give the world answers on what happene…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: 3/21/19: Red and Blue
articles.description: President Trump on Mueller report: Let it come out; Jimmy Carter about to become oldest living former president.

articles.author: Camilo Montoya-Galvez
articles.title: Pompeo: It's "possible" Trump was sent to save the Jewish people
articles.description: Secretary of state was asked if the president could be a present-day Queen Esther, a figure in Hebrew and Christian biblical stories. "As a Christian I certainly believe that's possible," he replied.
articles.content: During his high-profile visit to Israel, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said President Trump could be a present-day Queen Esther, a figure in Hebrew and Christian biblical stories who is said to have thwarted a plan to exterminate the Jewish people. Pompeo sa… [+3314 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Jimmy Carter set to become the oldest living president in U.S. history
articles.description: Jimmy Carter on Friday will pass George H.W. Bush to become the longest living president. In the years since he left office, he's become perhaps the most accomplished former president in American history. Chip Reid explains.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Emilia Clarke reveals she had 2 aneurysms
articles.description: Actress Emilia Clarked revealed in The New Yorker on Thursday that she had two life-threatening aneurysms and two brain surgeries since joining the cast of "Game of Thrones." The 32-year-old said that for a time, she was unable to speak.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Inside the struggle to live a normal life addicted to fentanyl
articles.description: Fatal drug overdoses peaked last year, according to preliminary data from the CDC, fueling hope that the deadliest addiction in American history has finally stalled. But fatalities are only part of the ongoing crisis. Tony Dokoupil reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: New Zealand prime minister announces ban on assault weapons
articles.description: Days after a deadly attack in New Zealand, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern announced a ban on assault weapons and high-capacity magazines. The government is also considering a plan to pay owners to turn in their weapons. Ben Tracy reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Spring floods could impact 200 million Americans
articles.description: Nearly two-thirds of the country could see flooding by the end of May. Areas along the Missouri River may not dry out for months. Don Dahler reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Trump tweets Israel should have sovereignty over Golan Heights
articles.description: President Trump upended decades of U.S. policy with a single tweet, declaring it's time to recognize Israeli control over the Golan Heights. It's one of the world's most disputed territories. Margaret Brennan explains.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Death toll rises after powerful cyclone hits Mozambique
articles.description: Rescues continue a full week after a poweful cyclone struck southern Africa. The death toll in three countries now tops 550, but it could go much higher. Debora Patta reports.

articles.author: Chip Reid
articles.title: Jimmy Carter set to become the oldest living president in U.S. history
articles.description: Since leaving office, Carter received the Nobel Peace Prize, worked on homes for Habitat for Humanity and taught Sunday school
articles.content: Washington — On Friday, Jimmy Carter will pass George H.W. Bush to become the longest living president, at 94 years and 172 days old. While some historians rank Carter as a below-average president, in the 38 years since he left office, he's become perhaps the… [+1199 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: 8-year-old boy has touching reaction after taking first steps
articles.description: An 8-year-old boy with cerebral palsy took his first steps recently – and the first thing he says to his parents is "thank you."

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Determined teen says first word in nearly 2 years
articles.description: A 16-year-old boy from South Carolina got into a head-on collision and suffered brain damage. Doctors didn't know if he'd live – let alone walk or talk again. Then, after two years of trying, he said his first word.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Cesar Sayoc pleads guilty to sending pipe bombs to Trump critics
articles.description: The man who sent homemade bombs to Hillary Clinton, Joe Biden and others pleaded guilty to criminal charges on Thursday. Cesar Sayoc now faces life in prison.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Thursday, March 21, 2019
articles.description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News" with Jeff Glor.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Marine commandant warns "combat readiness" could be impacted by border deployment
articles.description: The top Marine general issued a warning that combat readiness has been hurt in part by the president's troop deployment to the southern border. David Martin explains.
